page.title: 17LANDSCAPE GOONZION DOWNS
page.content: Goonzion (the name means dry downs) is a stretch of moorland in the western edge of the village.Here there is a bronze age barrow and evidence of extensive mining. Over the surface of these downs are mounds and depressions that mark early mine workings.Some of these are ancient.Elizabethan workings can clearly be seen.Underground mining did not begin until the 1830's.All the deep shafts have now been backfilled but the sites can clearly be seen.Part of the open cast mine was used by the villagers for refuse disposal and generations of St Neot people would dispose of their waste products there.Recently the villagers leveled this area and a flat grass area is the result.
